description: From Urdu بنجارا‎ (banjārā), apparently from Sanskrit बणिज् (baṇíj, “merchant, trader”).

entries.meaning: (India) A wandering grain and salt merchant in the Deccan Plateau.
examples: Thirty years ago this ford was on the track of the bunjaras, and I have seen two thousand pack-bullcoks cross in one night.
